result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Motion and Order to Withdraw as Counsel filed by Atty Anne Renc (sent to Br 3 Judge on 09/19/22 sp)
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant Record Update
Matter set for a P/S on 11/18/22 at 8:30 a.m.
Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed by Atty Anne Renc

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

3:17 PM Prosecuting attorney Jedidiah Dodge in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Randi J Piesik in court.  Attorney Anne Renc in court for Randi J Piesik. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
BY THE COURT: On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Bond continued.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Filed by Prosecutor.

2:12 PM Prosecuting attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Randi J Piesik in court.  Attorney Anne Renc in court for Randi J Piesik. 
Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on June 13, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
filed by Atty Anne Renc
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: filed by Atty Anne Renc

1:52 PM Prosecuting attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Randi J Piesik in court. 

Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Court finds the complaint shows probable cause in the complaint. 

Court reviews the minutes from the bond hearing which indicates he qualified for public defender. 
Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.
Defendant states he didn't at that time but he needs to provide them proof that he doesn't have a job and they will talk to him about it. 

BY THE COURT:  
The court expects the defendant to be represented by the public defender at the adjourned initial appearance. 
Bond continued.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Prior: 2551 Warner St, Stevens Point, WI 54481
**duplicate**
Initial Appearance set for April 4, 2022 @ 1:45 p.m. in Br 2

1:02 PM Defendant Randi Piesik appeared by video, Attorney Taylor O Soule appeared in court for Randi Piesik, Attorney Kelly A Cassidy appeared in court for State of Wis. 
Court Reporter is Lyssa Kaupie.

Court calls case.
Atty Cassidy states appearances.
ADA Cassidy states facts for anticipated charges of possession of meth as a repeater.
 20CF-393 is referred to.
Atty Soule does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Defendant is eligible for public defender services.

State requests a signature bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty  Soule does not have any objections as to bond.
Hearing scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
